intro: Gustavia augusta var. guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind or water.
